name: Macroeconomics and the Knowledge Economy
description: This course will introduce basic macroeconomics concepts such as national income and its determination, monetary and fiscal policy, comparative advantage, international trade and foreign exchange fluctuations. Issues relating to macroeconomic aspects of the knowledge economy will also be addressed. [24L, 12T]
prerequisites: CCT319H5 (or equivalent), 321H5 (or equivalent), 322H5 (or equivalent), 324H5 (or equivalent); MGM101H5 (or equivalent)
